Prepare
each of two wash buffers - Wash buffer #1 (4S-WB1) and #2 (4S-WB2), for later use during cleanup of RNA bound to silica columns.

source.title: Sample preparation, RNA preservation and particle lysis

source.description:
Obtain a
wastewater sample in a sterile sample collection tube. Maintain at
during transport to the lab.

source.body: Sodium chloride and TE buffer (Go to step 4) can be added to sample immediately after collection. Our unpublished analysis demonstrates that Sodium chloride & TE buffer preserve RNA present in wastewater.

source.title: Sample preparation, RNA preservation and particle lysis

source.description:
Resuspend dry bovine coronavirus stock (Bovilis Coronavirus Calf Vaccine) in
of PBS. Dilute this resuspended stock into PBS at a dilution of 1:10 (
of stock into
PBS). Spike 50uL of diluted bCoV into the wastewater sample as a recovery efficiency control. Agitate sample to fully mix bCoV or other spiked-in controls with the wastewater sample.

source.body: Other recovery controls can be used instead of bCoV. Some candidates include Phi6 bacteriophage and coronavirus OC43. In addition, purified RNAs can be used to quantify the extraction efficiency of "free RNA".

source.title: Sample preparation, RNA preservation and particle lysis

source.description:
Add
of sodium chloride to
wastewater sample.
Make
TE buffer (
TRIS,
EDTA).
Add
of TE buffer to
wastewater sample.

source.body: Here, NaCl lyses lipid-protein envelopes, denatures proteins and disrupts RNA-protein interactions. EDTA inhibits the enzymatic degradation of RNA by RNases present in wastewater and TRIS provides optimal buffering conditions for nucleic acids.

source.title: Sample preparation, RNA preservation and particle lysis

source.description:
Agitate sample until all NaCl dissolves in the wastewater. Vortex or shake sample for
to promote lysis.

source.title: Sample preparation, RNA preservation and particle lysis

source.description:
(OPTIONAL) Heat inactivate sample at
for
. Our unpublished analyses have shown that this step will not affect SARS-CoV-2 RNA enrichment and detection.

source.title: Sample preparation, RNA preservation and particle lysis

source.description: Filter the sample through a 5-um PVDF filter via syringe filtration or funnel top vacuum.

source.title: Direct RNA extraction (RNA Binding, Washing, Eluting)

source.description:
Aliquot
filtrate into two
aliquots. Add
of
ethanol to each
sample filtrate aliquot.

source.title: Direct RNA extraction (RNA Binding, Washing, Eluting)

source.description: Agitate sample to mix ethanol and wastewater lysate.

source.title: Direct RNA extraction (RNA Binding, Washing, Eluting)

source.description:
Attach Zymo III-P (or other) silica spin column to a vacuum manifold. Vacuum the full
volume (both aliquots) of wastewater lysate & ethanol through the spin column.

source.body: Commercial silica spin columns vary in their silica membrane packing tightness, changing the flow rate of lysed wastewater. We advise the use of the Zymo III-P column to avoid column clogging issues, but columns such as the Qiagen RNeasy, QIAamp Mini Spin and Zymogen II-CR can act as substitutes, depending on vacuum strength and sample particulate content. Large-format "maxiprep" style columns are also able to purify wastewater RNA, but require a large volume RNA elution up to 20mL (Step 13) and a dowstream precipitation-concentration step (Isopropanol precipitation, see companion protocol, Step 12) .

source.title: Direct RNA extraction (RNA Binding, Washing, Eluting)

source.description:
Vacuum
wash buffer #1 (4S-WB1) through the silica spin column.

source.title: Direct RNA extraction (RNA Binding, Washing, Eluting)

source.description:
Vacuum
wash buffer #2 (4S-WB2) through the silica spin column.

source.title: RNA elution

source.description: Detach silica spin column from vacuum manifold, remove any attached reservoirs/funnels and place column into a 1.5-mL centrifugation-compatible flowthrough collection tube.

source.title: RNA elution

source.description:
Centrifuge silica spin column in tube at
to remove any residual 4S-WB2 present in the column.

source.title: RNA elution

source.description: Discard the collection tube and place silica column into a new 1.5-mL centrifugation-compatible flowthrough collection tube.

source.title: RNA elution

source.description:
Pre-warm
of ZymoPURE elution buffer or
TE buffer per RNA sample to
in a heat block, waterbath or incubator.

source.title: RNA elution

source.description:
Add
of pre-warmed elution buffer to each silica spin column. Incubate the elution buffer and column + collection tube assembly in a heat block or incubator warmed to
for

source.title: RNA elution

source.description:
Spin at
to elute RNA from the column.
The flowthrough present in the collection tube contains the purified RNA.

source.title: Storage

source.description:
The eluted RNA is now ready for downstream analysis. Store RNA at
for same-day use or freeze at
for later use and storage.

description: This protocol describes the procedure of the "4S" (Sewage, Salt, Silica and SARS-CoV-2) method for SARS-CoV-2 RNA extraction from wastewater. Offering a highly efficient, modular and economical alternative to existing wastewater RNA purification methods, this procedure lowers the barrier to entry for SARS-CoV-2 wastewater-based epidemiology. This procedure is intended to be carried out in a BSL2+ laboratory space, with precautions when handling raw wastewater samples.
